name: PRIA
description: Complete a Code Review using OpenAI
author: Eric Wellnitz

inputs.name: api_key
inputs.label: OpenAI API Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: API Key for OpenAI API or Azure OpenAI endpoint.

inputs.name: api_version
inputs.label: Azure OpenAI API Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure OpenAI API Version. e.g., '2024-10-21'. See https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/openai/api-version-deprecation.

inputs.name: api_endpoint
inputs.label: Azure OpenAI Service Endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: Endpoint of Azure OpenAI Service. e.g., 'https://my-foundry-project.openai.azure.com/'

inputs.name: ai_model
inputs.label: OpenAI API Model
inputs.helpMarkDown:
## OpenAI API Model Configuration

### Description
Choose the OpenAI API model for code analysis. The selected model determines the depth and capabilities of the code review performed by OpenAI. If using Azure OpenAI services, this identifies the deployment.

### Options
- **gpt-4-1106-preview:** Preview version of GPT-4 released on June 11, 202x.
- **gpt-4-vision-preview:** Preview version of GPT-4 with enhanced vision capabilities.
- **gpt-4:** Latest stable release of GPT-4.
- **gpt-4-0314:** GPT-4 version released on March 14, 202x.
- **gpt-4-0613:** GPT-4 version released on June 13, 202x.
- **gpt-4-32k:** GPT-4 version with a 32k parameter size.
- **gpt-4-32k-0314:** GPT-4 version with 32k parameters, released on March 14, 202x.
- **gpt-4-32k-0613:** GPT-4 version with 32k parameters, released on June 13, 202x.
- **gpt-3.5-turbo-1106:** Preview version of GPT-3.5 Turbo released on November 6, 202x.
- **gpt-3.5-turbo:** Latest stable release of GPT-3.5 Turbo.
- **gpt-3.5-turbo-16k:** GPT-3.5 Turbo version with a 16k parameter size.
- **gpt-3.5-turbo-0301:** GPT-3.5 Turbo version released on March 1, 202x.
- **gpt-3.5-turbo-0613:** GPT-3.5 Turbo version released on June 13, 202x.
- **gpt-3.5-turbo-16k-0613:** GPT-3.5 Turbo version with 16k parameters, released on June 13, 202x.

### Default Value
The default OpenAI API model is set to **gpt-3.5-turbo**.

 Choose the model that best suits your code review requirements.

inputs.name: bugs
inputs.label: Check for bugs
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify whether to enable bug checking during the code review process.

- Set to `true` to perform bug checks.
- Set to `false` to skip bug checks.

Bug checking helps identify and address potential issues in the code. Default value is `true`.

inputs.name: performance
inputs.label: Check for performance problems
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify whether to include performance checks during the code review process.

- Set to `true` to perform performance checks.
- Set to `false` to skip performance checks.

Enabling performance checks helps identify and address potential performance-related issues in the code. Default value is `true`.

inputs.name: best_practices
inputs.label: Check for missed best practices
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify whether to include checks for missed best practices during the code review process.

- Set to `true` to perform best practices checks.
- Set to `false` to skip best practices checks.

Enabling best practices checks helps ensure adherence to coding standards and identifies areas for improvement. Default value is `true`.

inputs.name: modified_lines_only
inputs.label: Only check modified lines
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether to check modified lines only. Default value is `true`.

inputs.name: file_extensions
inputs.label: File extensions to include
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Deprecated: Use file_includes instead.  Specify a comma-separated list of file extensions for which you want to perform a code review. This input helps narrow down the scope of the code review to specific file types.

**Example:**
```plaintext
".js,.ts,.css,.html"
```

Make sure to provide the file extensions without spaces after the commas.

inputs.name: file_extension_excludes
inputs.label: File extensions to exclude
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Deprecated: Use file_excludes instead.  Specify a comma-separated list of file extensions that should be excluded from code reviews.

**Example:**
```plaintext
".js,.ts,.css,.html"
```

Make sure to provide the file extensions without spaces after the commas.

inputs.name: file_includes
inputs.label: Files to include
inputs.helpMarkDown:
## Files to Include Configuration

### Description
Specify a comma-separated list of glob-supported file names to be reviewed.

### Format
Provide a list of file names separated by commas. For example: `file1.js, *.py, secret.txt`

### Default Value
If no files are specified, all files will be considered for code review by default.

inputs.name: file_excludes
inputs.label: Files to exclude
inputs.helpMarkDown:
## Files to Exclude Configuration

### Description
Specify a comma-separated list of glob-supported file names that should be excluded from code reviews. This is useful for excluding sensitive files or preventing certain files from being reviewed.

### Format
Provide a list of file names separated by commas. For example: `file1.js, *.py, secret.txt`

### Default Value
If no files are specified, all files will be considered for code review by default.

inputs.name: additional_prompts
inputs.label: Additional Prompts
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify additional OpenAI prompts as a comma-separated list to enhance the code review process.

- Add multiple prompts separated by commas.
- These prompts will be used in conjunction with the main code review prompts.

**Example:**
```plaintext
Fix variable naming, Ensure consistent indentation, Review error handling approach
```

inputs.name: verbose_logging
inputs.label: Verbose Logging
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify to show additional debug logging. Default value is `false`.

inputs.name: comment_line_correction
inputs.label: Enable comment line correction
inputs.helpMarkDown: Correct comment line number and offsets.

inputs.name: allow_requeue
inputs.label: Allow reviewing on requeues
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set to true to allow reviewing on requeues.  Default value is `false`.

inputs.name: confidence_mode
inputs.label: Enable confidence mode (Experimental)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set to true to limit comments to those meeting the minimum confidence score.  Use in combination with the 'Minimum confidence score' input.

inputs.name: confidence_minimum
inputs.label: Minimum confidence score (Experimental)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the minimum confidence score (1-10) required for comments to appear. Only comments with a confidence score equal to or above this value will be shown.

inputs.name: dedupe_across_files
inputs.label: Enable deduplication of comments across files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set to true to prevent the same comment from appearing multiple times across different files in the code review. Use in combination with `dedupe_across_files_threshold`.

inputs.name: dedupe_across_files_threshold
inputs.label: Deduplication of comments across files threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the threshold of the total PR comments before deduplication is applied.
